Elevator.title: Elevator System Simulator
descriptionStrings: Designed and implemented an elevator system simulation using multithreaded design patterns
Developed elevator scheduling algorithms with feature flag controls to quantify performance differences between algorithms
Developed UDP communication systems to facilitate communications between the different subsystems to distribute computation remotely over VPN
Conducted integration testing & debugging in multithreaded contexts to ensure all subsystems interacted as expected
Led and organized team meetings to assign tasks and to parallelize workflow resulting in a 97% on the project

LetteredTabs.title: Lettered Tabs Web App
descriptionStrings: Designed & developed a web application that converts fret numbers in guitar tabs into their corresponding notes in any tuning to help musicians enhance their music theory knowledge through learning songs
Developed the conversion algorithms using Python, and the webapp using HTML, CSS, & JavaScript to create a simple user experience

MSP_Buzzer.title: Circuitboard Buzzer Instrument
descriptionStrings: Developed & deployed embedded C code to circuitboard to map musical notes to joystick positions to create a musical instrument for performances
This performance was then used as an example to demonstrate the hardware's capabilities to future classes

Risk.title: RISK GUI Board Game
descriptionStrings: Designed and implemented MVC design pattern to build a GUI, ensuring code maintainability for the continuous integration of new features
Developed and tested behavior for AI players to provide users with automated opponents
Developed processes for saving/loading using Java de/serialization libraries
Led and organized team meetings to assign tasks and to parallelize workflow resulting in an A+ on the project

Simulation.title: Assembly Line Simulation
descriptionStrings: Designed and implemented an event based simulation engine to simulate an algorithmic production line process
Developed statistical analysis functionality to quantify how changes in simulation algorithms and parameters impact performance metrics
Implemented multiplicative congruential random number generation mechanisms to allow for determinanistic simulation sequences for verification and validation
Using simulation, statistics, or random number generation libraries came with mark deductions because forced inefficiency is a better teacher than efficiency
Led and organized team meetings to groom & assign tasks to parallelize workflow resulting in an A+ on the project

Limidi_App.title: MIDI Controller Mobile App
descriptionStrings: Currently in the process of developing a mobile app that will act as a customizable remote MIDI controller to interface with digital audio workstation (DAW) software
Along with the mobile app acting as a frontend, a supporting desktop app is similtaneously being developed to act as a backend, with communications being facilitated via API calls over LAN networks
The mobile app is being developed with React Native, in an Expo environment for easy cross-platform development. Eventually, this app shall be available on Android, iOS, and iPad OS
The supporting desktop app is being developed with C#/.NET to be run as an IIS server. Big thank you to the NuGet package developers!

My ultimate goal with this project is to implant a mobile device into my guitar so that I will have easy control over software audio effects during performances, so that I can become the ultimate rockstar!

EngineeringProject.title: Capstone Engineering Project
descriptionStrings: Designing & developing a web based game to be used as an educational tool for technical employees to enhance corporate security skills, exploring themes of network security, physical security, and social engineering.
The game is themed around corporate warfare, and the player assumes the role of a top executive of a company, making decisions on defensive security investment while balancing limited budgets.

Along with the defensive side of security, the player will also have the ability conduct attacks on other companies, and economic conditions within the game will force the player to confront conflicts between morality and corporate survival.
Conducting attacks and defending against attacks will be implemented as minigames representing the security concept of interest.
Developed by a team of myself and 4 other software engineering students. Supervised by Dr. Jason Jaskolka, P.Eng
